articles.author: ESPN Staff
articles.title: India clinch their second T20 World Cup title in a thrilling final against South Africa
articles.description: India secured a 7-run victory over South Africa in the 2024 ICC Men's T20 World Cup final, with Virat Kohli's 76 runs and Hardik Pandya's three wickets playing pivotal roles.
articles.content: In a nail-biting finish at the Kensington Oval, India emerged victorious by 7 runs against South Africa to claim their second T20 World Cup title. Electing to bat first, India posted a total of 176/7, with Virat Kohli scoring a crucial 76 runs. In response, South Africa managed 169/8, falling short despite Heinrich Klaasen's valiant 52 off 27 balls. Hardik Pandya was instrumental with the ball, taking 3 wickets for 20 runs.
